16449  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
16450  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
16451  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
16452  else
16453  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
16454  }
16455  }
16456  return point;
16457 }
16458 
16468 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
16469 {
16470  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
16471  return QPolygonF();
16472 
16473  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
16474  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
16475  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
16476  if (!mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "channel fill target key axis invalid"; return QPolygonF(); }
16477 
16478  if (mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() != keyAxis->orientation())
16479  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
16480 
16481  if (lineData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
16482  QVector<QPointF> otherData;
16483  mChannelFillGraph.data()->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
16484  if (otherData.isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
16485  QVector<QPointF> thisData;
16486  thisData.reserve(lineData->size()+otherData.size()); // because we will join both vectors at end of this function
16487  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector), it squeezes internally, which ruins the performance tuning with reserve()
16488  thisData << lineData->at(i);
16489 
16490  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
16491  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
16492  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
16493 
16494  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
16495  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
16496  {
16497  // x is key
16498  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
16499  if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x())
16500  {
16501  int size = staticData->size();
16502  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16503  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
16504  }
16505  if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x())
16506  {
16507  int size = croppedData->size();
16508  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16509  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
16510  }
16511  // crop lower bound:
16512  if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
16513  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16514  int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
16515  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16516  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
16517  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
16518  // point via linear interpolation:
16519  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16520  double slope;
16521  if (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
16522  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
16523  else
16524  slope = 0;
16525  (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
16526  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
16527 
16528  // crop upper bound:
16529  if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
16530  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16531  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
16532  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16533  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
16534  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
16535  // point via linear interpolation:
16536  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16537  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
16538  if (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x() != 0)
16539  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
16540  else
16541  slope = 0;
16542  (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
16543  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
16544  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
16545  {
16546  // y is key
16547  // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is inverted compared to x,
16548  // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom to top like data coordinate.
16549  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
16550  if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y())
16551  {
16552  int size = staticData->size();
16553  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16554  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
16555  }
16556  if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y())
16557  {
16558  int size = croppedData->size();
16559  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16560  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
16561  }
16562  // crop lower bound:
16563  if (staticData->first().y() > croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
16564  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16565  int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
16566  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16567  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
16568  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
16569  // point via linear interpolation:
16570  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16571  double slope;
16572  if (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
16573  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
16574  else
16575  slope = 0;
16576  (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
16577  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
16578 
16579  // crop upper bound:
16580  if (staticData->last().y() < croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
16581  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16582  int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
16583  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16584  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
16585  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
16586  // point via linear interpolation:
16587  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16588  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
16589  if (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
16590  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
16591  else
16592  slope = 0;
16593  (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
16594  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
16595  }
16596 
16597  // return joined:
16598  for (int i=otherData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
16599  thisData << otherData.at(i);
16600  return QPolygonF(thisData);
16601 }
16602 
16610 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
16611 {
16612  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
16613  {
16614  if (data->at(i).x() < x)
16615  {
16616  if (i<data->size()-1)
16617  return i+1;
16618  else
16619  return data->size()-1;
16620  }
16621  }
16622  return -1;
16623 }
16624 
16632 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
16633 {
16634  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
16635  {
16636  if (data->at(i).x() > x)
16637  {
16638  if (i>0)
16639  return i-1;
16640  else
16641  return 0;
16642  }
16643  }
16644  return -1;
16645 }
16646 
16654 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
16655 {
16656  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
16657  {
16658  if (data->at(i).y() < y)
16659  {
16660  if (i>0)
16661  return i-1;
16662  else
16663  return 0;
16664  }
16665  }
16666  return -1;
16667 }
16668 
16679 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
16680 {
16681  if (mData->isEmpty())
16682  {
16683  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on graph" << mName << "without data";
16684  return 500;
16685  }
16686  if (mData->size() == 1)
16687  {
16688  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
16689  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
16690  }
16691 
16692  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
16693  return 500;
16694 
16695  // calculate minimum distances to graph representation:
16696  if (mLineStyle == lsNone)
16697  {
16698  // no line displayed, only calculate distance to scatter points:
16699  QVector<QCPData> *scatterData = new QVector<QCPData>;
16700  getScatterPlotData(scatterData);
16701  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
16702  QPointF ptA;
16703  QPointF ptB = coordsToPixels(scatterData->at(0).key, scatterData->at(0).value); // getScatterPlotData returns in plot coordinates, so transform to pixels
16704  for (int i=1; i<scatterData->size(); ++i)
16705  {
16706  ptA = ptB;
16707  ptB = coordsToPixels(scatterData->at(i).key, scatterData->at(i).value);
16708  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(ptA, ptB, pixelPoint);
16709  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16710  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16711  }
16712  delete scatterData;
16713  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
16714  } else
16715  {
16716  // line displayed calculate distance to line segments:
16717  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
16718  getPlotData(lineData, 0); // unlike with getScatterPlotData we get pixel coordinates here
16719  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
16720  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
16721  {
16722  // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData points are only pairwise connected:
16723  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; i+=2) // iterate pairs
16724  {
16725  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
16726  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16727  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16728  }
16729  } else
16730  {
16731  // all other line plots (line and step) connect points directly:
16732  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
16733  {
16734  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
16735  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16736  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16737  }
16738  }
16739  delete lineData;
16740  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
16741  }
16742 }
16743 
16752 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
16753 {
16754  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
16755  {
16756  if (data->at(i).y() > y)
16757  {
16758  if (i<data->size()-1)
16759  return i+1;
16760  else
16761  return data->size()-1;
16762  }
16763  }
16764  return -1;
16765 }
16766 
16767 /* inherits documentation from base class */
16768 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
16769 {
16770  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
16771  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
16772  return getKeyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
16773 }
16774 
16775 /* inherits documentation from base class */
16776 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
16777 {
16778  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
16779  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
16780  return getValueRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
16781 }
16782 
16789 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
16790 {
16791  QCPRange range;
16792  bool haveLower = false;
16793  bool haveUpper = false;
16794 
16795  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
16796 
16797  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
16798  {
16799  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16800  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16801  {
16802  current = it.value().key;
16803  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16804  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16805  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
16806  {
16807  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16808  haveLower = true;
16809  }
16810  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
16811  {
16812  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16813  haveUpper = true;
16814  }
16815  ++it;
16816  }
16817  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
16818  {
16819  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16820  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16821  {
16822  current = it.value().key;
16823  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16824  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16825  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
16826  {
16827  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16828  haveLower = true;
16829  }
16830  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
16831  {
16832  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16833  haveUpper = true;
16834  }
16835  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
16836  {
16837  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
16838  {
16839  range.lower = current;
16840  haveLower = true;
16841  }
16842  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
16843  {
16844  range.upper = current;
16845  haveUpper = true;
16846  }
16847  }
16848  ++it;
16849  }
16850  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
16851  {
16852  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16853  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16854  {
16855  current = it.value().key;
16856  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16857  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16858  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
16859  {
16860  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16861  haveLower = true;
16862  }
16863  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
16864  {
16865  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16866  haveUpper = true;
16867  }
16868  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
16869  {
16870  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
16871  {
16872  range.lower = current;
16873  haveLower = true;
16874  }
16875  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
16876  {
16877  range.upper = current;
16878  haveUpper = true;
16879  }
16880  }
16881  ++it;
16882  }
16883  }
16884 
16885  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
16886  return range;
16887 }
16888 
16895 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
16896 {
16897  QCPRange range;
16898  bool haveLower = false;
16899  bool haveUpper = false;
16900 
16901  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
16902 
16903  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
16904  {
16905  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16906  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16907  {
16908  current = it.value().value;
16909  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16910  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16911  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
16912  {
16913  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16914  haveLower = true;
16915  }
16916  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
16917  {
16918  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16919  haveUpper = true;
16920  }
16921  ++it;
16922  }
16923  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
16924  {
16925  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16926  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16927  {
16928  current = it.value().value;
16929  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16930  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16931  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
16932  {
16933  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16934  haveLower = true;
16935  }
16936  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
16937  {
16938  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16939  haveUpper = true;
16940  }
16941  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
16942  {
16943  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
16944  {
16945  range.lower = current;
16946  haveLower = true;
16947  }
16948  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
16949  {
16950  range.upper = current;
16951  haveUpper = true;
16952  }
16953  }
16954  ++it;
16955  }
16956  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
16957  {
16958  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16959  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16960  {
16961  current = it.value().value;
16962  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16963  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16964  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
16965  {
16966  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16967  haveLower = true;
16968  }
16969  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
16970  {
16971  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16972  haveUpper = true;
16973  }
16974  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
16975  {
16976  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
16977  {
16978  range.lower = current;
16979  haveLower = true;
16980  }
16981  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
16982  {
16983  range.upper = current;
16984  haveUpper = true;
16985  }
16986  }
16987  ++it;
16988  }
16989  }
16990 
16991  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
16992  return range;
16993 }
16994 
16995 
16999 
17016 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData() :
17017  t(0),
17018  key(0),
17019  value(0)
17020 {
17021 }
17022 
17026 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData(double t, double key, double value) :
17027  t(t),
17028  key(key),
17029  value(value)
17030 {
17031 }
17032 
17033 
17037 
17079 QCPCurve::QCPCurve(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
17080  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
17081 {
17082  mData = new QCPCurveDataMap;
17083  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
17084  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
17085  mBrush.setColor(Qt::blue);
17086  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::NoBrush);
17087  mSelectedPen = mPen;
17088  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
17089  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
17090  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
17091 
17092  setScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle());
17093  setLineStyle(lsLine);
17094 }
17095 
17096 QCPCurve::~QCPCurve()
17097 {
17098  delete mData;
17099 }
17100 
17108 void QCPCurve::setData(QCPCurveDataMap *data, bool copy)
17109 {
17110  if (copy)
17111  {
17112  *mData = *data;
17113  } else
17114  {
17115  delete mData;
17116  mData = data;
17117  }
17118 }
17119 
17126 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
17127 {
17128  mData->clear();
17129  int n = t.size();
17130  n = qMin(n, key.size());
17131  n = qMin(n, value.size());
17132  QCPCurveData newData;
17133  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
17134  {
17135  newData.t = t[i];
17136  newData.key = key[i];
17137  newData.value = value[i];
17138  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
17139  }
17140 }
17141 
17147 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
17148 {
17149  mData->clear();
17150  int n = key.size();
17151  n = qMin(n, value.size());
17152  QCPCurveData newData;
17153  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
17154  {
17155  newData.t = i; // no t vector given, so we assign t the index of the key/value pair
17156  newData.key = key[i];
17157  newData.value = value[i];
17158  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
17159  }
17160 }
17161 
17169 void QCPCurve::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style)
17170 {
17171  mScatterStyle = style;
17172 }
17173 
17181 void QCPCurve::setLineStyle(QCPCurve::LineStyle style)
17182 {
17183  mLineStyle = style;
17184 }
17185 
17190 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveDataMap &dataMap)
17191 {
17192  mData->unite(dataMap);
17193 }
17194 
17199 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveData &data)
17200 {
17201  mData->insertMulti(data.t, data);
17202 }
17203 
17208 void QCPCurve::addData(double t, double key, double value)
17209 {
17210  QCPCurveData newData;
17211  newData.t = t;
17212  newData.key = key;
17213  newData.value = value;
17214  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
17215 }
17216 
17225 void QCPCurve::addData(double key, double value)
17226 {
17227  QCPCurveData newData;
17228  if (!mData->isEmpty())
17229  newData.t = (mData->constEnd()-1).key()+1;
17230  else
17231  newData.t = 0;
17232  newData.key = key;
17233  newData.value = value;
17234  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
17235 }
17236 
17241 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &ts, const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
17242 {
17243  int n = ts.size();
17244  n = qMin(n, keys.size());
17245  n = qMin(n, values.size());
17246  QCPCurveData newData;
17247  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
17248  {
17249  newData.t = ts[i];
17250  newData.key = keys[i];
17251  newData.value = values[i];
17252  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
17253  }
17254 }
17255 
17260 void QCPCurve::removeDataBefore(double t)
17261 {
17262  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
17263  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < t)
17264  it = mData->erase(it);
17265 }
17266 
17271 void QCPCurve::removeDataAfter(double t)
17272 {
17273  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17274  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(t);
17275  while (it != mData->end())
17276  it = mData->erase(it);
17277 }
17278 
17286 void QCPCurve::removeData(double fromt, double tot)
17287 {
17288  if (fromt >= tot || mData->isEmpty()) return;
17289  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromt);
17290  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(tot);
17291  while (it != itEnd)
17292  it = mData->erase(it);
17293 }
17294 
17304 void QCPCurve::removeData(double t)
17305 {
17306  mData->remove(t);
17307 }
17308 
17313 void QCPCurve::clearData()
17314 {
17315  mData->clear();
17316 }
17317 
17318 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17319 double QCPCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
17320 {
17321  Q_UNUSED(details)
17322  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
17323  return -1;
17324  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
17325 
17326  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
17327  return pointDistance(pos);
17328  else
17329  return -1;
17330 }
17331 
17332 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17333 void QCPCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
17334 {
17335  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17336 
17337  // allocate line vector:
17338  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
17339 
17340  // fill with curve data:
17341  getCurveData(lineData);
17342 
17343  // check data validity if flag set:
17344 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
17345  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
17346  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
17347  {
17348  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().t) ||
17349  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
17350  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
17351  }
17352 #endif
17353 
17354  // draw curve fill:
17355  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
17356  {
17357  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17358  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
17359  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
17360  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
17361  }
17362 
17363  // draw curve line:
17364  if (mLineStyle != lsNone && mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
17365  {
17366  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17367  painter->setPen(mainPen());
17368  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
17369  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
17370  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
17371  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
17372  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized) &&
17373  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching))
17374  {
17375  int i = 1;
17376  int lineDataSize = lineData->size();
17377  while (i < lineDataSize)
17378  {
17379  if (!qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) && !qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // NaNs create a gap in the line
17380  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
17381  else
17382  ++i;
17383  ++i;
17384  }
17385  } else
17386  {
17387  int segmentStart = 0;
17388  int i = 0;
17389  int lineDataSize = lineData->size();
17390  while (i < lineDataSize)
17391  {
17392  if (qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).y()) || qIsNaN(lineData->at(i).x())) // NaNs create a gap in the line
17393  {
17394  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+segmentStart, i-segmentStart); // i, because we don't want to include the current NaN point
17395  segmentStart = i+1;
17396  }
17397  ++i;
17398  }
17399  // draw last segment:
17400  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+segmentStart, lineDataSize-segmentStart); // lineDataSize, because we do want to include the last point
17401  }
17402  }
17403 
17404  // draw scatters:
17405  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17406  drawScatterPlot(painter, lineData);
17407 
17408  // free allocated line data:
17409  delete lineData;
17410 }
17411 
17412 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17413 void QCPCurve::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
17414 {
17415  // draw fill:
17416  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
17417  {
17418  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17419  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
17420  }
17421  // draw line vertically centered:
17422  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
17423  {
17424  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17425  painter->setPen(mPen);
17426  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
17427  }
17428  // draw scatter symbol:
17429  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17430  {
17431  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
17432  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
17433  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
17434  {
17435  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
17436  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
17437  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17438  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
17439  } else
17440  {
17441  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17442  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
17443  }
17444  }
17445 }
17446 
17452 void QCPCurve::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> *pointData) const
17453 {
17454  // draw scatter point symbols:
17455  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
17456  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17457  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
17458  if (!qIsNaN(pointData->at(i).x()) && !qIsNaN(pointData->at(i).y()))
17459  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, pointData->at(i));
17460 }
17461 
17475 void QCPCurve::getCurveData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
17476 {
17477  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17478  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17479  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
17480 
17481  // add margins to rect to compensate for stroke width
17482  double strokeMargin = qMax(qreal(1.0), qreal(mainPen().widthF()*0.75)); // stroke radius + 50% safety
17483  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17484  strokeMargin = qMax(strokeMargin, mScatterStyle.size());
17485  double rectLeft = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().lower)-strokeMargin*((keyAxis->orientation()==Qt::Vertical)!=keyAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17486  double rectRight = keyAxis->pixelToCoord(keyAxis->coordToPixel(keyAxis->range().upper)+strokeMargin*((keyAxis->orientation()==Qt::Vertical)!=keyAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17487  double rectBottom = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().lower)+strokeMargin*((valueAxis->orientation()==Qt::Horizontal)!=valueAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17488  double rectTop = valueAxis->pixelToCoord(valueAxis->coordToPixel(valueAxis->range().upper)-strokeMargin*((valueAxis->orientation()==Qt::Horizontal)!=valueAxis->rangeReversed()?-1:1));
17489  int currentRegion;
17490  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17491  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator prevIt = mData->constEnd()-1;
17492  int prevRegion = getRegion(prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17493  QVector<QPointF> trailingPoints; // points that must be applied after all other points (are generated only when handling first point to get virtual segment between last and first point right)
17494  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17495  {
17496  currentRegion = getRegion(it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17497  if (currentRegion != prevRegion) // changed region, possibly need to add some optimized edge points or original points if entering R
17498  {
17499  if (currentRegion != 5) // segment doesn't end in R, so it's a candidate for removal
17500  {
17501  QPointF crossA, crossB;
17502  if (prevRegion == 5) // we're coming from R, so add this point optimized
17503  {
17504  lineData->append(getOptimizedPoint(currentRegion, it.value().key, it.value().value, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom));
17505  // in the situations 5->1/7/9/3 the segment may leave R and directly cross through two outer regions. In these cases we need to add an additional corner point
17506  *lineData << getOptimizedCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17507  } else if (mayTraverse(prevRegion, currentRegion) &&
17508  getTraverse(prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom, crossA, crossB))
17509  {
17510  // add the two cross points optimized if segment crosses R and if segment isn't virtual zeroth segment between last and first curve point:
17511  QVector<QPointF> beforeTraverseCornerPoints, afterTraverseCornerPoints;
17512  getTraverseCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom, beforeTraverseCornerPoints, afterTraverseCornerPoints);
17513  if (it != mData->constBegin())
17514  {
17515  *lineData << beforeTraverseCornerPoints;
17516  lineData->append(crossA);
17517  lineData->append(crossB);
17518  *lineData << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
17519  } else
17520  {
17521  lineData->append(crossB);
17522  *lineData << afterTraverseCornerPoints;
17523  trailingPoints << beforeTraverseCornerPoints << crossA ;
17524  }
17525  } else // doesn't cross R, line is just moving around in outside regions, so only need to add optimized point(s) at the boundary corner(s)
17526  {
17527  *lineData << getOptimizedCornerPoints(prevRegion, currentRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17528  }
17529  } else // segment does end in R, so we add previous point optimized and this point at original position
17530  {
17531  if (it == mData->constBegin()) // it is first point in curve and prevIt is last one. So save optimized point for adding it to the lineData in the end
17532  trailingPoints << getOptimizedPoint(prevRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom);
17533  else
17534  lineData->append(getOptimizedPoint(prevRegion, prevIt.value().key, prevIt.value().value, it.value().key, it.value().value, rectLeft, rectTop, rectRight, rectBottom));
17535  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
17536  }
17537  } else // region didn't change
17538  {
17539  if (currentRegion == 5) // still in R, keep adding original points
17540  {
17541  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
17542  } else // still outside R, no need to add anything
17543  {
17544  // see how this is not doing anything? That's the main optimization...
17545  }
17546  }
17547  prevIt = it;
17548  prevRegion = currentRegion;
17549  ++it;
17550  }
17551  *lineData << trailingPoints;
17552 }
17553 
17572 int QCPCurve::getRegion(double x, double y, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom) const
17573 {
17574  if (x < rectLeft) // region 123
17575  {
17576  if (y > rectTop)
17577  return 1;
17578  else if (y < rectBottom)
17579  return 3;
17580  else
17581  return 2;
17582  } else if (x > rectRight) // region 789
17583  {
17584  if (y > rectTop)
17585  return 7;
17586  else if (y < rectBottom)
17587  return 9;
17588  else
17589  return 8;
17590  } else // region 456
17591  {
17592  if (y > rectTop)
17593  return 4;
17594  else if (y < rectBottom)
17595  return 6;
17596  else
17597  return 5;
17598  }
17599 }
17600 
17616 QPointF QCPCurve::getOptimizedPoint(int otherRegion, double otherKey, double otherValue, double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom) const
17617 {
17618  double intersectKey = rectLeft; // initial value is just fail-safe
17619  double intersectValue = rectTop; // initial value is just fail-safe
17620  switch (otherRegion)
17621  {
17622  case 1: // top and left edge
17623  {
17624  intersectValue = rectTop;
17625  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17626  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17627  {
17628  intersectKey = rectLeft;
17629  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17630  }
17631  break;
17632  }
17633  case 2: // left edge
17634  {
17635  intersectKey = rectLeft;
17636  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17637  break;
17638  }
17639  case 3: // bottom and left edge
17640  {
17641  intersectValue = rectBottom;
17642  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17643  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17644  {
17645  intersectKey = rectLeft;
17646  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17647  }
17648  break;
17649  }
17650  case 4: // top edge
17651  {
17652  intersectValue = rectTop;
17653  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17654  break;
17655  }
17656  case 5:
17657  {
17658  break; // case 5 shouldn't happen for this function but we add it anyway to prevent potential discontinuity in branch table
17659  }
17660  case 6: // bottom edge
17661  {
17662  intersectValue = rectBottom;
17663  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17664  break;
17665  }
17666  case 7: // top and right edge
17667  {
17668  intersectValue = rectTop;
17669  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17670  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17671  {
17672  intersectKey = rectRight;
17673  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17674  }
17675  break;
17676  }
17677  case 8: // right edge
17678  {
17679  intersectKey = rectRight;
17680  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17681  break;
17682  }
17683  case 9: // bottom and right edge
17684  {
17685  intersectValue = rectBottom;
17686  intersectKey = otherKey + (key-otherKey)/(value-otherValue)*(intersectValue-otherValue);
17687  if (intersectKey < rectLeft || intersectKey > rectRight) // doesn't intersect, so must intersect other:
17688  {
17689  intersectKey = rectRight;
17690  intersectValue = otherValue + (value-otherValue)/(key-otherKey)*(intersectKey-otherKey);
17691  }
17692  break;
17693  }
17694  }
17695  return coordsToPixels(intersectKey, intersectValue);
17696 }
17697 
17716 QVector<QPointF> QCPCurve::getOptimizedCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double prevKey, double prevValue, double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom) const
17717 {
17718  QVector<QPointF> result;
17719  switch (prevRegion)
17720  {
17721  case 1:
17722  {
17723  switch (currentRegion)
17724  {
17725  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17726  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17727  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17728  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17729  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17730  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17731  case 9: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17732  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectLeft-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17733  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); }
17734  else
17735  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); }
17736  break;
17737  }
17738  }
17739  break;
17740  }
17741  case 2:
17742  {
17743  switch (currentRegion)
17744  {
17745  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17746  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17747  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17748  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17749  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17750  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17751  }
17752  break;
17753  }
17754  case 3:
17755  {
17756  switch (currentRegion)
17757  {
17758  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17759  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17760  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17761  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17762  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17763  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17764  case 7: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17765  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectRight-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17766  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); }
17767  else
17768  { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); }
17769  break;
17770  }
17771  }
17772  break;
17773  }
17774  case 4:
17775  {
17776  switch (currentRegion)
17777  {
17778  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17779  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17780  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17781  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17782  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17783  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17784  }
17785  break;
17786  }
17787  case 5:
17788  {
17789  switch (currentRegion)
17790  {
17791  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17792  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17793  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17794  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17795  }
17796  break;
17797  }
17798  case 6:
17799  {
17800  switch (currentRegion)
17801  {
17802  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17803  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17804  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17805  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17806  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17807  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17808  }
17809  break;
17810  }
17811  case 7:
17812  {
17813  switch (currentRegion)
17814  {
17815  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17816  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17817  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17818  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17819  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17820  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17821  case 3: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17822  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectRight-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17823  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); }
17824  else
17825  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); }
17826  break;
17827  }
17828  }
17829  break;
17830  }
17831  case 8:
17832  {
17833  switch (currentRegion)
17834  {
17835  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17836  case 9: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17837  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17838  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17839  case 1: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
17840  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17841  }
17842  break;
17843  }
17844  case 9:
17845  {
17846  switch (currentRegion)
17847  {
17848  case 6: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17849  case 8: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
17850  case 3: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
17851  case 7: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
17852  case 2: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17853  case 4: { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); break; }
17854  case 1: { // in this case we need another distinction of cases: segment may pass below or above rect, requiring either bottom right or top left corner points
17855  if ((value-prevValue)/(key-prevKey)*(rectLeft-key)+value < rectBottom) // segment passes below R
17856  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); }
17857  else
17858  { result << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom) << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); result.append(result.last()); result << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); }
17859  break;
17860  }
17861  }
17862  break;
17863  }
17864  }
17865  return result;
17866 }
17867 
17880 bool QCPCurve::mayTraverse(int prevRegion, int currentRegion) const
17881 {
17882  switch (prevRegion)
17883  {
17884  case 1:
17885  {
17886  switch (currentRegion)
17887  {
17888  case 4:
17889  case 7:
17890  case 2:
17891  case 3: return false;
17892  default: return true;
17893  }
17894  }
17895  case 2:
17896  {
17897  switch (currentRegion)
17898  {
17899  case 1:
17900  case 3: return false;
17901  default: return true;
17902  }
17903  }
17904  case 3:
17905  {
17906  switch (currentRegion)
17907  {
17908  case 1:
17909  case 2:
17910  case 6:
17911  case 9: return false;
17912  default: return true;
17913  }
17914  }
17915  case 4:
17916  {
17917  switch (currentRegion)
17918  {
17919  case 1:
17920  case 7: return false;
17921  default: return true;
17922  }
17923  }
17924  case 5: return false; // should never occur
17925  case 6:
17926  {
17927  switch (currentRegion)
17928  {
17929  case 3:
17930  case 9: return false;
17931  default: return true;
17932  }
17933  }
17934  case 7:
17935  {
17936  switch (currentRegion)
17937  {
17938  case 1:
17939  case 4:
17940  case 8:
17941  case 9: return false;
17942  default: return true;
17943  }
17944  }
17945  case 8:
17946  {
17947  switch (currentRegion)
17948  {
17949  case 7:
17950  case 9: return false;
17951  default: return true;
17952  }
17953  }
17954  case 9:
17955  {
17956  switch (currentRegion)
17957  {
17958  case 3:
17959  case 6:
17960  case 8:
17961  case 7: return false;
17962  default: return true;
17963  }
17964  }
17965  default: return true;
17966  }
17967 }
17968 
17969 
17983 bool QCPCurve::getTraverse(double prevKey, double prevValue, double key, double value, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom, QPointF &crossA, QPointF &crossB) const
17984 {
17985  QList<QVector2D> intersections; // x of QVector2D corresponds to key and y to value
17986  if (qFuzzyIsNull(key-prevKey)) // line is parallel to value axis
17987  {
17988  // due to region filter in mayTraverseR(), if line is parallel to value or key axis, R is traversed here
17989  intersections.append(QVector2D(key, rectBottom)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
17990  intersections.append(QVector2D(key, rectTop));
17991  } else if (qFuzzyIsNull(value-prevValue)) // line is parallel to key axis
17992  {
17993  // due to region filter in mayTraverseR(), if line is parallel to value or key axis, R is traversed here
17994  intersections.append(QVector2D(rectLeft, value)); // direction will be taken care of at end of method
17995  intersections.append(QVector2D(rectRight, value));
17996  } else // line is skewed
17997  {
17998  double gamma;
17999  double keyPerValue = (key-prevKey)/(value-prevValue);
18000  // check top of rect:
18001  gamma = prevKey + (rectTop-prevValue)*keyPerValue;
18002  if (gamma >= rectLeft && gamma <= rectRight)
18003  intersections.append(QVector2D(gamma, rectTop));
18004  // check bottom of rect:
18005  gamma = prevKey + (rectBottom-prevValue)*keyPerValue;
18006  if (gamma >= rectLeft && gamma <= rectRight)
18007  intersections.append(QVector2D(gamma, rectBottom));
18008  double valuePerKey = 1.0/keyPerValue;
18009  // check left of rect:
18010  gamma = prevValue + (rectLeft-prevKey)*valuePerKey;
18011  if (gamma >= rectBottom && gamma <= rectTop)
18012  intersections.append(QVector2D(rectLeft, gamma));
18013  // check right of rect:
18014  gamma = prevValue + (rectRight-prevKey)*valuePerKey;
18015  if (gamma >= rectBottom && gamma <= rectTop)
18016  intersections.append(QVector2D(rectRight, gamma));
18017  }
18018 
18019  // handle cases where found points isn't exactly 2:
18020  if (intersections.size() > 2)
18021  {
18022  // line probably goes through corner of rect, and we got duplicate points there. single out the point pair with greatest distance in between:
18023  double distSqrMax = 0;
18024  QVector2D pv1, pv2;
18025  for (int i=0; i<intersections.size()-1; ++i)
18026  {
18027  for (int k=i+1; k<intersections.size(); ++k)
18028  {
18029  double distSqr = (intersections.at(i)-intersections.at(k)).lengthSquared();
18030  if (distSqr > distSqrMax)
18031  {
18032  pv1 = intersections.at(i);
18033  pv2 = intersections.at(k);
18034  distSqrMax = distSqr;
18035  }
18036  }
18037  }
18038  intersections = QList<QVector2D>() << pv1 << pv2;
18039  } else if (intersections.size() != 2)
18040  {
18041  // one or even zero points found (shouldn't happen unless line perfectly tangent to corner), no need to draw segment
18042  return false;
18043  }
18044 
18045  // possibly re-sort points so optimized point segment has same direction as original segment:
18046  if ((key-prevKey)*(intersections.at(1).x()-intersections.at(0).x()) + (value-prevValue)*(intersections.at(1).y()-intersections.at(0).y()) < 0) // scalar product of both segments < 0 -> opposite direction
18047  intersections.swap(0, 1);
18048  crossA = coordsToPixels(intersections.at(0).x(), intersections.at(0).y());
18049  crossB = coordsToPixels(intersections.at(1).x(), intersections.at(1).y());
18050  return true;
18051 }
18052 
18078 void QCPCurve::getTraverseCornerPoints(int prevRegion, int currentRegion, double rectLeft, double rectTop, double rectRight, double rectBottom, QVector<QPointF> &beforeTraverse, QVector<QPointF> &afterTraverse) const
18079 {
18080  switch (prevRegion)
18081  {
18082  case 1:
18083  {
18084  switch (currentRegion)
18085  {
18086  case 6: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
18087  case 9: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
18088  case 8: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
18089  }
18090  break;
18091  }
18092  case 2:
18093  {
18094  switch (currentRegion)
18095  {
18096  case 7: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
18097  case 9: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
18098  }
18099  break;
18100  }
18101  case 3:
18102  {
18103  switch (currentRegion)
18104  {
18105  case 4: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
18106  case 7: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
18107  case 8: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
18108  }
18109  break;
18110  }
18111  case 4:
18112  {
18113  switch (currentRegion)
18114  {
18115  case 3: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
18116  case 9: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
18117  }
18118  break;
18119  }
18120  case 5: { break; } // shouldn't happen because this method only handles full traverses
18121  case 6:
18122  {
18123  switch (currentRegion)
18124  {
18125  case 1: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
18126  case 7: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
18127  }
18128  break;
18129  }
18130  case 7:
18131  {
18132  switch (currentRegion)
18133  {
18134  case 2: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
18135  case 3: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
18136  case 6: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectTop); break; }
18137  }
18138  break;
18139  }
18140  case 8:
18141  {
18142  switch (currentRegion)
18143  {
18144  case 1: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
18145  case 3: { afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectBottom); break; }
18146  }
18147  break;
18148  }
18149  case 9:
18150  {
18151  switch (currentRegion)
18152  {
18153  case 2: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
18154  case 1: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); afterTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectLeft, rectTop); break; }
18155  case 4: { beforeTraverse << coordsToPixels(rectRight, rectBottom); break; }
18156  }
18157  break;
18158  }
18159  }
18160 }
18161 
18168 double QCPCurve::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
18169 {
18170  if (mData->isEmpty())
18171  {
18172  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on curve" << mName << "without data";
18173  return 500;
18174  }
18175  if (mData->size() == 1)
18176  {
18177  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
18178  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
18179  }
18180 
18181  // calculate minimum distance to line segments:
18182  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
18183  getCurveData(lineData);
18184  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
18185  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
18186  {
18187  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
18188  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
18189  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
18190  }
18191  delete lineData;
18192  return qSqrt(minDistSqr);
18193 }
18194 
18195 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18196 QCPRange QCPCurve::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
18197 {
18198  QCPRange range;
18199  bool haveLower = false;
18200  bool haveUpper = false;
18201 
18202  double current;
18203 
18204  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18205  while (it != mData->constEnd())
18206  {
18207  current = it.value().key;
18208  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
18209  {
18210  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
18211  {
18212  range.lower = current;
18213  haveLower = true;
18214  }
18215  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
18216  {
18217  range.upper = current;
18218  haveUpper = true;
18219  }
18220  }
18221  ++it;
18222  }
18223 
18224  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
18225  return range;
18226 }
18227 
18228 /* inherits documentation from base class */
18229 QCPRange QCPCurve::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
18230 {
18231  QCPRange range;
18232  bool haveLower = false;
18233  bool haveUpper = false;
18234 
18235  double current;
18236 
18237  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
18238  while (it != mData->constEnd())
18239  {
18240  current = it.value().value;
18241  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
18242  {
18243  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
18244  {
18245  range.lower = current;
18246  haveLower = true;
18247  }
18248  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
18249  {
18250  range.upper = current;
18251  haveUpper = true;
18252  }
18253  }
18254  ++it;
18255  }
18256 
18257  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
18258  return range;
18259 }
18260 
18261 
18265 
18299 /* start of documentation of inline functions */
18300 
18327 /* end of documentation of inline functions */
18328 
18332 QCPBarsGroup::QCPBarsGroup(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
18333  QObject(parentPlot),
18334  mParentPlot(parentPlot),
18335  mSpacingType(stAbsolute),
18336  mSpacing(4)
18337 {
18338 }
18339 
18340 QCPBarsGroup::~QCPBarsGroup()
18341 {
18342  clear();
18343 }
18344 
18352 void QCPBarsGroup::setSpacingType(SpacingType spacingType)
18353 {
18354  mSpacingType = spacingType;
18355 }
18356 
18363 void QCPBarsGroup::setSpacing(double spacing)
18364 {
18365  mSpacing = spacing;
18366 }
18367 
18374 QCPBars *QCPBarsGroup::bars(int index) const
18375 {
18376  if (index >= 0 && index < mBars.size())
18377  {
18378  return mBars.at(index);
18379  } else
18380  {
18381  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
18382  return 0;
18383  }
18384 }
18385 
18391 void QCPBarsGroup::clear()
18392 {
18393  foreach (QCPBars *bars, mBars) // since foreach takes a copy, removing bars in the loop is okay
18394  bars->setBarsGroup(0); // removes itself via removeBars
18395 }
18396 
18403 void QCPBarsGroup::append(QCPBars *bars)
18404 {
18405  if (!bars)
18406  {
18407  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
18408  return;
18409  }
18410 
18411  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
18412  bars->setBarsGroup(this);
18413  else
18414  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars plottable is already in this bars group:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(bars);
18415 }
18416 
18426 void QCPBarsGroup::insert(int i, QCPBars *bars)
18427 {
18428  if (!bars)
18429  {
18430  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
18431  return;
18432  }
18433 
18434  // first append to bars list normally:
18435  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
18436  bars->setBarsGroup(this);
18437  // then move to according position:
18438  mBars.move(mBars.indexOf(bars), qBound(0, i, mBars.size()-1));
18439 }
18440 
18446 void QCPBarsGroup::remove(QCPBars *bars)
18447 {
18448  if (!bars)
18449  {
18450  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars is 0";
18451  return;
18452  }
18453 
18454  if (mBars.contains(bars))
18455  bars->setBarsGroup(0);
18456  else
18457  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "bars plottable is not in this bars group:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(bars);
18458 }
18459 
18467 void QCPBarsGroup::registerBars(QCPBars *bars)
18468 {
18469  if (!mBars.contains(bars))
18470  mBars.append(bars);
18471 }
18472 
18480 void QCPBarsGroup::unregisterBars(QCPBars *bars)
18481 {
18482  mBars.removeOne(bars);
18483 }
18484 
18491 double QCPBarsGroup::keyPixelOffset(const QCPBars *bars, double keyCoord)
18492 {
18493  // find list of all base bars in case some mBars are stacked:
18494  QList<const QCPBars*> baseBars;
18495  foreach (const QCPBars *b, mBars)
18496  {
18497  while (b->barBelow())
18498  b = b->barBelow();
18499  if (!baseBars.contains(b))
18500  baseBars.append(b);
18501  }
18502  // find base bar this "bars" is stacked on:
18503  const QCPBars *thisBase = bars;
18504  while (thisBase->barBelow())
18505  thisBase = thisBase->barBelow();
18506 
18507  // determine key pixel offset of this base bars considering all other base bars in this barsgroup:
18508  double result = 0;
18509  int index = baseBars.indexOf(thisBase);
18510  if (index >= 0)
18511  {
18512  int startIndex;
18513  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth;
18514  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 1 && index == (baseBars.size()-1)/2) // is center bar (int division on purpose)
18515  {
18516  return result;
18517  } else if (index < (baseBars.size()-1)/2.0) // bar is to the left of center
18518  {
18519  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 0) // even number of bars
18520  {
18521  startIndex = baseBars.size()/2-1;
18522  result -= getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(startIndex), keyCoord)*0.5; // half of middle spacing
18523  } else // uneven number of bars
18524  {
18525  startIndex = (baseBars.size()-1)/2-1;
18526  baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18527  result -= qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5; // half of center bar
18528  result -= getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2), keyCoord); // center bar spacing
18529  }
18530  for (int i=startIndex; i>index; --i) // add widths and spacings of bars in between center and our bars
18531  {
18532  baseBars.at(i)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18533  result -= qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth);
18534  result -= getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(i), keyCoord);
18535  }
18536  // finally half of our bars width:
18537  baseBars.at(index)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18538  result -= qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5;
18539  } else // bar is to the right of center
18540  {
18541  if (baseBars.size() % 2 == 0) // even number of bars
18542  {
18543  startIndex = baseBars.size()/2;
18544  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(startIndex), keyCoord)*0.5; // half of middle spacing
18545  } else // uneven number of bars
18546  {
18547  startIndex = (baseBars.size()-1)/2+1;
18548  baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18549  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5; // half of center bar
18550  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at((baseBars.size()-1)/2), keyCoord); // center bar spacing
18551  }
18552  for (int i=startIndex; i<index; ++i) // add widths and spacings of bars in between center and our bars
18553  {
18554  baseBars.at(i)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18555  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth);
18556  result += getPixelSpacing(baseBars.at(i), keyCoord);
18557  }
18558  // finally half of our bars width:
18559  baseBars.at(index)->getPixelWidth(keyCoord, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
18560  result += qAbs(upperPixelWidth-lowerPixelWidth)*0.5;
18561  }
18562  }
18563  return result;
18564 }
18565 
18576 double QCPBarsGroup::getPixelSpacing(const QCPBars *bars, double keyCoord)
18577 {
18578  switch (mSpacingType)
18579  {
18580  case stAbsolute:
18581  {
18582  return mSpacing;
18583  }
18584  case stAxisRectRatio:
18585  {
18586  if (bars->keyAxis()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
18587  return bars->keyAxis()->axisRect()->width()*mSpacing;
18588  else
18589  return bars->keyAxis()->axisRect()->height()*mSpacing;
18590  }
18591  case stPlotCoords:
18592  {
18593  double keyPixel = bars->keyAxis()->coordToPixel(keyCoord);
18594  return bars->keyAxis()->coordToPixel(keyCoord+mSpacing)-keyPixel;
18595  }
18596  }
18597  return 0;
18598 }
18599 
18600 
18604 
18620 QCPBarData::QCPBarData() :
18621  key(0),
18622  value(0)
18623 {
18624 }
18625 
18629 QCPBarData::QCPBarData(double key, double value) :
18630  key(key),
18631  value(value)
18632 {
18633 }
18634 
18635 
18639 
18679 /* start of documentation of inline functions */
18680 
18695 /* end of documentation of inline functions */
18696 
18706 QCPBars::QCPBars(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
18707  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis),
18708  mData(new QCPBarDataMap),
18709  mWidth(0.75),
18710  mWidthType(wtPlotCoords),
18711  mBarsGroup(0),
18712  mBaseValue(0)
18713 {
18714  // modify inherited properties from abstract plottable:
18715  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
18716  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
18717  mBrush.setColor(QColor(40, 50, 255, 30));
18718  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::SolidPattern);
18719  mSelectedPen = mPen;
18720  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
18721  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
18722  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
18723 }
18724 
18725 QCPBars::~QCPBars()
18726 {
18727  setBarsGroup(0);
18728  if (mBarBelow || mBarAbove)
18729  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // take this bar out of any stacking
18730  delete mData;
18731 }
18732 
18739 void QCPBars::setWidth(double width)
18740 {
18741  mWidth = width;
18742 }
18743 
18752 void QCPBars::setWidthType(QCPBars::WidthType widthType)
18753 {
18754  mWidthType = widthType;
18755 }
18756 
18763 void QCPBars::setBarsGroup(QCPBarsGroup *barsGroup)
18764 {
18765  // deregister at old group:
18766  if (mBarsGroup)
18767  mBarsGroup->unregisterBars(this);
18768  mBarsGroup = barsGroup;
18769  // register at new group:
18770  if (mBarsGroup)
18771  mBarsGroup->registerBars(this);
18772 }
18773 
18786 void QCPBars::setBaseValue(double baseValue)
18787 {
18788  mBaseValue = baseValue;
18789 }
18790 
18798 void QCPBars::setData(QCPBarDataMap *data, bool copy)
18799 {
18800  if (copy)
18801  {
18802  *mData = *data;
18803  } else
18804  {
18805  delete mData;
18806  mData = data;
18807  }
18808 }
18809 
18816 void QCPBars::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
18817 {
18818  mData->clear();
18819  int n = key.size();
18820  n = qMin(n, value.size());
18821  QCPBarData newData;
18822  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
18823  {
18824  newData.key = key[i];
18825  newData.value = value[i];
18826  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
18827  }
18828 }
18829 
18844 void QCPBars::moveBelow(QCPBars *bars)
18845 {
18846  if (bars == this) return;
18847  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
18848  {
18849  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
18850  return;
18851  }
18852  // remove from stacking:
18853  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
18854  // if new bar given, insert this bar below it:
18855  if (bars)
18856  {
18857  if (bars->mBarBelow)
18858  connectBars(bars->mBarBelow.data(), this);
18859  connectBars(this, bars);
18860  }
18861 }
18862 
18877 void QCPBars::moveAbove(QCPBars *bars)
18878 {
18879  if (bars == this) return;
18880  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
18881  {
18882  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
18883  return;
18884  }
18885  // remove from stacking:
18886  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
18887  // if new bar given, insert this bar above it:
18888  if (bars)
18889  {
18890  if (bars->mBarAbove)
18891  connectBars(this, bars->mBarAbove.data());
18892  connectBars(bars, this);
18893  }
18894 }
18895 
18900 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarDataMap &dataMap)
18901 {
18902  mData->unite(dataMap);
18903 }
18904 
18909 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarData &data)
18910 {
18911  mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
18912 }
18913 
18918 void QCPBars::addData(double key, double value)
18919 {
18920  QCPBarData newData;
18921  newData.key = key;
18922  newData.value = value;
18923  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
18924 }
18925 
18930 void QCPBars::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
18931 {
18932  int n = keys.size();
18933  n = qMin(n, values.size());
18934  QCPBarData newData;
18935  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
18936  {
18937  newData.key = keys[i];
18938  newData.value = values[i];
18939  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
18940  }
18941 }
18942 
18947 void QCPBars::removeDataBefore(double key)
18948 {
18949  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
18950  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
18951  it = mData->erase(it);
18952 }
18953 
18958 void QCPBars::removeDataAfter(double key)
18959 {
18960  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
18961  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
18962  while (it != mData->end())
18963  it = mData->erase(it);
18964 }
18965 
18973 void QCPBars::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
18974 {
18975  if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
18976  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
18977  QCPBarDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
18978  while (it != itEnd)
18979  it = mData->erase(it);
18980 }
18981 
18990 void QCPBars::removeData(double key)
18991 {
18992  mData->remove(key);
18993 }
18994 
18999 void QCPBars::clearData()
19000 {
19001  mData->clear();
19002 }
19003 
19004 /* inherits documentation from base class */
19005 double QCPBars::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
19006 {
19007  Q_UNUSED(details)
19008  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
19009  return -1;
19010  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
19011 
19012  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
19013  {
19014  QCPBarDataMap::ConstIterator it;
19015  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
19016  {
19017  if (getBarPolygon(it.value().key, it.value().value).boundingRect().contains(pos))
19018  return mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*0.99;
19019  }
19020  }
19021  return -1;
19022 }
19023 
19024 /* inherits documentation from base class */
19025 void QCPBars::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
19026 {
19027  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
19028  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
19029 
19030  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it, lower, upperEnd;
19031  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upperEnd);
19032  for (it = lower; it != upperEnd; ++it)
19033  {
19034  // check data validity if flag set:
19035 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
19036  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
19037  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "of drawn range invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
19038 #endif
19039  QPolygonF barPolygon = getBarPolygon(it.key(), it.value().value);
19040  // draw bar fill:
19041  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
19042  {
19043  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
19044  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
19045  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
19046  painter->drawPolygon(barPolygon);
19047  }
19048  // draw bar line:
19049  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
19050  {
19051  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
19052  painter->setPen(mainPen());
19053  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
19054  painter->drawPolyline(barPolygon);
19055  }
19056  }
19057 }
19058 
19059 /* inherits documentation from base class */
19060 void QCPBars::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
19061 {
19062  // draw filled rect:
19063  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
19064  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
19065  painter->setPen(mPen);
19066  QRectF r = QRectF(0, 0, rect.width()*0.67, rect.height()*0.67);
19067  r.moveCenter(rect.center());
19068  painter->drawRect(r);
19069 }
19070 
19085 void QCPBars::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator &lower, QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator &upperEnd) const
19086 {
19087  if (!mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
19088  if (mData->isEmpty())
19089  {
19090  lower = mData->constEnd();
19091  upperEnd = mData->constEnd();
19092  return;
19093  }
19094 
19095  // get visible data range as QMap iterators
19096  lower = mData->lowerBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
19097  upperEnd = mData->upperBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
19098  double lowerPixelBound = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
19099  double upperPixelBound = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
19100  bool isVisible = false;
19101  // walk left from lbound to find lower bar that actually is completely outside visible pixel range:
19102  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
19103  while (it != mData->constBegin())
19104  {
19105  --it;
19106  QRectF barBounds = getBarPolygon(it.value().key, it.value().value).boundingRect();
19107  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
19108  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.right() >= lowerPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.left() <= lowerPixelBound));
19109  else // keyaxis is vertical
19110  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.top() <= lowerPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.bottom() >= lowerPixelBound));
19111  if (isVisible)
19112  lower = it;
19113  else
19114  break;
19115  }
19116  // walk right from ubound to find upper bar that actually is completely outside visible pixel range:
19117  it = upperEnd;
19118  while (it != mData->constEnd())
19119  {
19120  QRectF barBounds = getBarPolygon(upperEnd.value().key, upperEnd.value().value).boundingRect();
19121  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
19122  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.left() <= upperPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.right() >= upperPixelBound));
19123  else // keyaxis is vertical
19124  isVisible = ((!mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.bottom() >= upperPixelBound) || (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() && barBounds.top() <= upperPixelBound));
19125  if (isVisible)
19126  upperEnd = it+1;
19127  else
19128  break;
19129  ++it;
19130  }
19131 }
19132 
19139 QPolygonF QCPBars::getBarPolygon(double key, double value) const
19140 {
19141  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
19142  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
19143  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
19144 
19145  QPolygonF result;
19146  double lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth;
19147  getPixelWidth(key, lowerPixelWidth, upperPixelWidth);
19148  double base = getStackedBaseValue(key, value >= 0);
19149  double basePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(base);
19150  double valuePixel = valueAxis->coordToPixel(base+value);
19151  double keyPixel = keyAxis->coordToPixel(key);
19152  if (mBarsGroup)
19153  keyPixel += mBarsGroup->keyPixelOffset(this, key);
19154  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
19155  {
19156  result << QPointF(keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth, basePixel);
19157  result << QPointF(keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth, valuePixel);
19158  result << QPointF(keyPixel+upperPixelWidth, valuePixel);
19159  result << QPointF(keyPixel+upperPixelWidth, basePixel);
19160  } else
19161  {
19162  result << QPointF(basePixel, keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth);
19163  result << QPointF(valuePixel, keyPixel+lowerPixelWidth);
19164  result << QPointF(valuePixel, keyPixel+upperPixelWidth);
19165  result << QPointF(basePixel, keyPixel+upperPixelWidth);
19166  }
19167  return result;
19168 }
19169 
19179 void QCPBars::getPixelWidth(double key, double &lower, double &upper) const
19180 {
19181  switch (mWidthType)
19182  {
19183  case wtAbsolute:
19184  {
19185  upper = mWidth*0.5;
19186  lower = -upper;
19187  if (mKeyAxis && (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() ^ (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)))
19188  qSwap(lower, upper);
19189  break;
19190  }
19191  case wtAxisRectRatio:
19192  {
19193  if (mKeyAxis && mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect())
19194  {
19195  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
19196  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->width()*mWidth*0.5;
19197  else
19198  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->height()*mWidth*0.5;
19199  lower = -upper;
19200  if (mKeyAxis && (mKeyAxis.data()->rangeReversed() ^ (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)))
19201  qSwap(lower, upper);
19202  } else
19203  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "No key axis or axis rect defined";
19204  break;
19205  }
19206  case wtPlotCoords:
19207  {
19208  if (mKeyAxis)
19209  {
19210  double keyPixel = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key);
19211  upper = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key+mWidth*0.5)-keyPixel;
19212  lower = mKeyAxis.data()->coordToPixel(key-mWidth*0.5)-keyPixel;
19213  // no need to qSwap(lower, higher) when range reversed, because higher/lower are gained by
19214  // coordinate transform which includes range direction
19215  } else
19216  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "No key axis defined";
19217  break;
19218  }
19219  }
19220 }
19221 
19231 double QCPBars::getStackedBaseValue(double key, bool positive) const
19232 {
19233  if (mBarBelow)
19234  {
19235  double max = 0; // don't use mBaseValue here because only base value of bottom-most bar has meaning in a bar stack
19236  // find bars of mBarBelow that are approximately at key and find largest one:
19237  double epsilon = qAbs(key)*1e-6; // should be safe even when changed to use float at some point
19238  if (key == 0)
19239  epsilon = 1e-6;
19240  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mBarBelow.data()->mData->lowerBound(key-epsilon);
19241  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator itEnd = mBarBelow.data()->mData->upperBound(key+epsilon);
19242  while (it != itEnd)
19243  {
19244  if ((positive && it.value().value > max) ||
19245  (!positive && it.value().value < max))
19246  max = it.value().value;
19247  ++it;
19248  }
19249  // recurse down the bar-stack to find the total height:
19250  return max + mBarBelow.data()->getStackedBaseValue(key, positive);
19251  } else
19252  return mBaseValue;
19253 }
19254
